7038e003d060.description: Intelligent ideas for upgrading yourself. Follow for business, productivity, life and health advice.
7038e003d060.name: Better Humans

paragraphs.text: “Effective knowledge workers, in my observation, do not start with their tasks. They start with their time.”
paragraphs.name: 5f6c
6fd8
paragraphs.text: You bet. There’s one thing that everyone has to manage. It’s something very close to us — ourselves.

paragraphs.name: 15f8
paragraphs.text: Outsource by hiring a freelancer to do things that you are less good at (scheduling, babysit, web design, walk the dog, outreach, marketing, etc.)

8ec7028d906c.title: The Effective Executive distills all this stuff into a more applicable system.

paragraphs.text: The Effective Executive distills all this stuff into a more applicable system. I made it a point, while running my business, to reread it annually.
paragraphs.name: a411

paragraphs.text: Thanks for this Charles. Do you recommend any other books by Drucker? I’ve always found his teachings helpful and applicable.
Nice speech
paragraphs.name: cf71

d3c51887c00a.title: One of the best articles I’ve read!

paragraphs.text: One of the best articles I’ve read!
paragraphs.name: 5a46

515364e3d345.title: The irony is that I read this post while I really should have been working.

paragraphs.text: The irony is that I read this post while I really should have been working. Point taken: less planning, more jump-starting. Planning can be intermingled with actual work.
paragraphs.name: 9d81

paragraphs.text: Can you elaborate on this? Do you mean for a parent to outsource to a baby-sitter certain parenting activities?
paragraphs.name: 522f

paragraphs.text: Measurement is key
paragraphs.name: b5bb

paragraphs.text: Charles Chu
paragraphs.name: 14a4

paragraphs.text: Thanks for the RescueTime tip. I have not formally measured my computer time yet. Frankly, I am a bit nervous to see the results. I have made a great deal of progress on hard/fast policies (I don’t use Facebook at all, for instance). However, I worry about how I am…
paragraphs.name: e8af

paragraphs.text: Hi Charlie,
paragraphs.name: 1b9b

paragraphs.text: Awesome article! I just completed tracking every 30 minute period of my last month with Google Calendar, RescueTime, and a few other apps. If you want to check out my results/takeaways, the link is below:
paragraphs.name: ec64

paragraphs.text: https://medium.com/@jeffreylam/my-first-quantified-self-project-tracking-the-last-744-hours-of-my-life-fcd2a1cf47b
paragraphs.name: e8bf

virtuals.subtitle: Awesome article! I just completed tracking every 30 minute period of my last month with Google Calendar, RescueTime, and a few other apps…

content.subtitle: Awesome article! I just completed tracking every 30 minute period of my last month with Google Calendar, RescueTime, and a few other apps…

bd27a6d1b6c6.title: in some way,time decides our whole life

paragraphs.text: in some way,time decides our whole life
paragraphs.name: 9c5f

paragraphs.text: This is a great article! I am going to implement measuring out my time on a weekly basis to find out where all of it goes.. Great job Charles Chu with your insight!
paragraphs.name: b601

virtuals.subtitle: Productivity tips from one of the greatest thinkers in the history of management.
virtuals.metaDescription: His prolific writings — over 30 books — have gone on to sell millions of copies and inspire young managers all over the world.  What if you’re a freelancer, an office grunt, or just a hermit living…

content.subtitle: Productivity tips from one of the greatest thinkers in the history of management.
content.metaDescription: His prolific writings — over 30 books — have gone on to sell millions of copies and inspire young managers all over the world.  What if you’re a freelancer, an office grunt, or just a hermit living…

d1ad5ff462d8.title: The most important project you’ll ever manage is yourself.

paragraphs.text: The most important project you’ll ever manage is yourself.
It’s a concept I drive home with the clients I work with.
paragraphs.name: a3bb

paragraphs.text: Having the ability to recognize costs and resources, sharpen core competencies and prioritize as necessary is invaluable.
paragraphs.name: a3c0

virtuals.subtitle: It’s a concept I drive home with the clients I work with.

content.subtitle: It’s a concept I drive home with the clients I work with.
